CONCLUSION: Remainder inadmissible;Violation of Art. 5-1-f;Violation of Art. 5-4;Non-pecuniary damage - award
JUDGES: Anatoly Kovler;Christos Rozakis;Dean Spielmann;Elisabeth Steiner;George Nicolaou;Giorgio Malinverni;Sverre Erik Jebens
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant arrived in GPE from GPE . In DATE he asked GPE United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees to grant him refugee status . DATE refugee status was granted and the applicant was informed of his right to move to GPE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the acting chief of the GPE Town police department of GPE faxed a letter to the chief of the GPE police department asking him to arrest the applicant . The letter read as follows :

“ [ We ] seek your order to arrest a criminal , [ the applicant ] , wanted by us for having committed a crime ( theft of ORG property ) under LAW of GPE ... criminal case no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL . The arrest warrant and order for transport were issued on DATE by the first deputy military prosecutor of GPE . ”
A translation of the arrest warrant of CARDINAL DATE was attached to the letter .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Prosecutor General of GPE received a letter from ORG of the ORG High Commissioner for Refugees , informing him about the applicant ’s refugee status . The letter read as follows :

“ The Regional Representation of the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees in the NORP Federation applies to you in connection with the case of Mr Gunduz Eminbeyli , which was examined by the ORG in DATE , as a result of which [ the applicant ] was granted refugee status and was considered in need of international protection under the ORG mandate in the territory of GPE .
In DATE GPE accepted [ the applicant ] as a refugee with permanent leave to remain , in support of which he was given a travel document and issued with an entry visa for that country .

As it follows from the information obtained by us , a federal search warrant was issued in respect of [ the applicant ] on the basis of the fact that the NORP authorities accused him of having committed criminal actions ; the [ accusation ] prevents him from leaving GPE .

Due to the fact that [ the applicant ] is a proxy of the former Prime Minister of GPE , Mr PERSON , who subsequently became a leader of the opposition to the Government of PERSON in GPE , and due to the fact that he worked with an NORP national , PERSON , whose case was examined by ORG office DATE , the ORG has grounds to conclude that the true reasons for the warrant issued by the NORP authorities are [ the applicant ’s ] work with and close ties to the above - mentioned NORP political figures .

As we were informed by GPE Department of Visas and Registration where [ the applicant ] lives and with whom he lodged his application for a visa , the NORP authorities lodged a request for [ the applicant ’s ] extradition .

The ORG is concerned that if [ the applicant ] is expelled to GPE , there will be a danger of a violation of LAW of LAW relating to LAW ... and of GPE of DATE ... by GPE . LAW relating to ORG forbids an expulsion of persons to a country where their lives and freedom will be threatened by a persecution on account of his race , religion , nationality , membership of a particular social group or political opinion . ”
The UNHCR Representation in GPE sent a similar letter to GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE police officers arrested the applicant pursuant to the faxed letter of DATE and placed him in the temporary detention unit of GPE and GPE ORG of the Interior ( ORG города Санкт-Петербурга и ORG области ) . A police investigator issued a report on the applicant ’s arrest . The report represented a CARDINAL - page printed template , in which the dates , the applicant ’s name , and the grounds for his arrest were filled in by hand . The relevant part read as follows ( the pre - printed part in plain script and the part written by hand in italics ) :
“ I , [ the police investigator ] , ... on the basis of the order of the prosecutor of GPE . , arrested an individual,[the applicant ] , born on CARDINAL DATE , ...
Reasons for the arrest
Receipt of the prosecutor ’s arrest warrant
The arrested is brought to the police station no . CARDINAL
For that the present report is drawn up by [ the police investigator ’s signature ] .
Signature of the arrested person [ the applicant ’s signature ] . ”
The second page of the report contained information on the applicant ’s body search .

CARDINAL . The applicant insisted that he had not been informed about the reasons for his arrest and he had not been given a certified copy of the arrest warrant . He was later served with a translation of the warrant which was attached to the letter of DATE . The applicant further alleged that the conditions of his detention in the unit had been very poor .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG sent a letter , on the applicant ’s behalf , to the head of the St. GPE police department , complaining about the applicant ’s arrest with a view to extradition and seeking additional information on the case .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG retained a lawyer , PERSON , to represent the applicant . On the same day PERSON arrived at the detention unit for a meeting with the applicant , but she was not allowed to see him . DATE PERSON complained to GPE that she had been barred from seeing her client .

CARDINAL . On DATE PERSON lodged an application with FAC of GPE seeking the applicant ’s release and complaining that he had been unlawfully arrested and detained . A copy of the lawyer ’s complaint bears the stamp of ORG showing that it received the complaint on DATE it had been sent . On DATE Ms Tseytlina was allowed to visit the applicant .

CARDINAL . The Government , relying on a letter issued by the deputy President of ORG , submitted that on DATE ORG had forwarded PERSON complaint to the GPE prosecutor ’s office finding that ORG had the exclusive jurisdiction to examine extradition matters . PERSON complained to GPE about the transfer of her complaint to the prosecution authorities . ORG forwarded that complaint to ORG . ORG decided to examine the merits of the application for release and the lawyer ’s complaints and fixed the first hearing for DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG received a request for the applicant ’s extradition from ORG . The NORP authorities stated that the applicant was suspected of having committed aggravated robbery with the aim of acquiring ORG property on DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Prosecutor General of GPE , relying on LAW relating to LAW , dismissed the request for the extradition . The Prosecutor General stressed that the applicant had been granted refugee status and that he had been allowed to take up permanent residence in GPE . The ORG also noted that GPE office had been given an order for the applicant ’s immediate release .
CARDINAL . According to the Government , ORG order reached the prosecutor ’s office of LOC of GPE on DATE . ORG immediately authorised the applicant ’s release .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant moved to GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG adjourned for DATE the proceedings concerning the examination of the lawfulness of the applicant ’s detention to allow the prosecutor to examine the case file . The following hearing listed for DATE was also rescheduled for DATE to obtain additional documents from the parties .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG dismissed PERSON complaint concerning the applicant ’s detention . ORG held that the detention was lawful . The applicant was detained at the request of the NORP authorities with a view to his extradition . Criminal proceedings were instituted against him in GPE , he absconded and his arrest was authorised . The NORP authorities requested the applicant ’s extradition in good time and submitted all necessary documents in compliance with the requirements of LAW of DATE . The applicant was released after the extradition request had been dismissed .

CARDINAL . PERSON lodged an appeal statement . She complained that the applicant ’s arrest had not been authorised as required by domestic law , that the faxed letter from the chief of the police department could not have served as the legal basis for the arrest , that the NORP authorities had not issued any detention order in respect of the applicant , that he had not been promptly informed about the reasons for his arrest and that there had been no legal grounds for the applicant ’s detention CARDINAL and DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE GPE upheld the decision of DATE . ORG held :

“ ... [ The applicant ] , having permanent residence in the territory of GPE , was placed on the inter - State wanted ORG list by the law - enforcement organs of the above - mentioned ORG as a person who had absconded from investigation . His remand in custody was authorised ( the detention order of CARDINAL DATE ) .

On DATE [ the applicant ] was arrested on the basis of the warrant issued by GPE with the view to his extradition in accordance with LAW of DATE on ORG , Family and Criminal Cases ( thereafter – the Convention ) ...
The NORP officials had submitted the request for the [ applicant ’s ] arrest ... on DATE and , thus , the court correctly held that the [ applicant ’s ] detention was lawful .

... the period of [ the applicant ’s ] detention in the temporary detention unit of GPE and ORG amounts to DATE ( DATE and DATE ) and conforms to the requirements of LAW , which indicates that a person arrested pursuant to LAW of the Minsk Convention shall be released if no request for extradition is received within DATE of the arrest . The request of ORG for [ the applicant ’s ] extradition was received by the Prosecutor ’s General office on DATE , DATE after [ the applicant ’s ] arrest in GPE .
[ The applicant ] was released on DATE after ORG ordered his release in connection with the decision refusing the request of ORG for his extradition . ”
CARDINAL . The LAW guarantees the right to liberty ( LAW ) :
“ CARDINAL . Everyone has the right to liberty and personal integrity .

CARDINAL . Arrest , placement in custody and detention are only permitted on the basis of a judicial decision . Prior to a judicial decision , an individual may not be detained for longer than TIME . ”

CARDINAL . The Convention on Legal Assistance and Legal Relations in Civil , Family and Criminal Matters ( signed in GPE on DATE and amended on DATE , “ the DATE Minsk Convention ” ) , to which both GPE and GPE are parties , provides as follows :

“ When executing a request for legal assistance the requested authority should implement domestic legal norms . ORG which seeks legal assistance may ask the other ORG to use the legal norms of the requesting ORG , if those norms do not contradict legal norms of ORG providing legal assistance ... ”
“ CARDINAL . The Contracting Parties shall ... on each other ’s requests extradite persons , who find themselves in their territory , for criminal prosecution or serving a sentence .

CARDINAL . Extradition for criminal prosecution shall extend to offences which are criminally punishable under the laws of the requesting and requested Contracting Parties , and which entail DATE imprisonment or a heavier sentence . ”
“ CARDINAL . A request for extradition shall include the following information :
( a ) NORP the title of the requesting and requested authorities ;
( b ) the description of the factual circumstances of the offence , the text of the law of the requesting ORG which criminalises the offence , and the punishment sanctioned by that law ;

( c ) the [ name ] of the person to be extradited , DATE of his birth , citizenship , place of residence , and , if possible , the description of his appearance , his photograph , fingerprints and other personal information ;
( d ) information concerning the damage caused by the offence .
CARDINAL . A request for extradition for the purpose of criminal persecution shall be accompanied by a certified copy of a detention order .... ”

“ After a request for extradition is received , the requested ORG immediately takes measures to retrieve and detain a person whose extradition is sought save for those cases when the person can not be extradited . ”

“ CARDINAL . NORP The person whose extradition is sought may also be arrested before receipt of a request for extradition , if there is a related petition . The petition shall contain a reference to a detention order ... and shall indicate that a request for extradition will follow . A petition for arrest ... may be sent by post , wire , telex or fax .

CARDINAL . NORP The person may also be detained without the petition referred to in point CARDINAL above if there are legal grounds to suspect that he has committed , in the territory of the other ORG , an offence entailing extradition .
CARDINAL . NORP In case of [ the person ’s ] arrest or detention before receipt of the request for extradition , the other ORG shall be informed immediately . ”

“ CARDINAL . The Contracting Parties shall ... search for the person before receipt of the request for extradition if there are reasons to believe that this person may be in the territory of the requested ORG ....
CARDINAL . A request for the search ... shall contain ... a request for the person ’s arrest and a promise to submit a request for his extradition .
CARDINAL . A request for the search shall be accompanied by a certiﬁed copy of ... the detention order ....
CARDINAL . The requesting Contracting ORG shall be immediately informed about the person ’s arrest or about other results of the search . ”
“ CARDINAL . A person arrested pursuant to LAW and LAW shall be released ... if no request for extradition is received by the requested ORG within DATE of the arrest .
CARDINAL . A person arrested pursuant to LAW shall be released if no petition issued pursuant to LAW arrives within the time established by the law concerning arrest . ”

“ The requested ORG shall notify the requesting ORG of the place and time of surrender . If the requesting ORG does not accept the person being extradited within DATE of the scheduled date of surrender , that person shall be released . ”
“ Relations concerning extradition issues and criminal prosecution are performed by ORG ( prosecutors ) of the ORG Parties . ”
CARDINAL . LAW of DATE ( ORG no . CARDINAL ) , to which GPE is a party , provides as follows :

“ CARDINAL . Extradition shall not be granted if the offence in respect of which it is requested is regarded by the requested ORG as a political offence or as an offence connected with a political offence .

CARDINAL . The same rule shall apply if the requested ORG has substantial grounds for believing that a request for extradition for an ordinary criminal offence has been made for the purpose of prosecuting or punishing a person on account of his race , religion , nationality or political opinion , or that that person ’s position may be prejudiced for any of these reasons . ”

“ CARDINAL . In case of urgency the competent authorities of the requesting ORG may request the provisional arrest of the person sought . The competent authorities of the requested ORG shall decide the matter in accordance with its law .

CARDINAL . Provisional arrest may be terminated if , within DATE after arrest , the requested ORG has not received the request for extradition and the documents mentioned in LAW . It shall not , in any event , exceed DATE from the date of such arrest . The possibility of provisional release at any time is not excluded , but the requested ORG shall take any measures which it considers necessary to prevent the escape of the person sought . ”
CARDINAL . The United Nations Convention relating to ORG , adopted on DATE , provided as follows :

“ CARDINAL . No Contracting State shall expel or return ( “ refouler ” ) a refugee in any manner whatsoever to the frontiers of territories where his life or freedom would be threatened on account of his race , religion , nationality , membership of a particular social group or political opinion .

CARDINAL . NORP The benefit of the present provision may not , however , be claimed by a refugee whom there are reasonable grounds for regarding as a danger to the security of the country in which he is , or who , having been convicted by a final judgment of a particularly serious crime , constitutes a danger to the community of that country . ”
CARDINAL . The Federal Law “ On refugees ” ( no . PERSON of DATE ) provided as follows :
“ CARDINAL . The following basic definitions are applied for the purposes of the present Federal Law :

CARDINAL ) A refugee is a person who is not a national of GPE and who , owing to a well - founded fear of persecution for reasons of race , religion , nationality , ethnic origin , membership of a particular social group or political opinion , is outside the country of his nationality and is unable or , owing to such fear , is unwilling to avail himself of the protection of that country ; or who , not having a nationality and being outside the country of his former habitual residence as a result of such events , is unable or , owing to such fear , is unwilling to return to it ...

“ CARDINAL . A person ... who is granted refugee status ... cannot be expelled against his will to the territory of the ORG of his nationality ( of his former permanent residence ) if the conditions described in LAW ( CARDINAL ) of the present LAW are still in force in that State ... ”

CARDINAL . LAW between GPE and GPE ORG , Family and Criminal Cases ( “ the DATE LAW ) , adopted on DATE ( in force since DATE ) provides that the State Parties effect legal relations through their respective Ministers of ORG and the offices of the Prosecutors General .

CARDINAL . By virtue of LAW , each ORG applies its own law in order to carry out the other ORG ’s request for legal assistance . Only on an explicit request of another ORG may a ORG to the LAW apply another ORG ’s law in so far as it does not contradict the law of ORG .

CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL of the LAW sets out the requirements for an extradition request . The request should contain the name of the requesting authority , an extract from the requesting ORG ’s law according to which an imputed act or omission constitutes a crime , the name of the person whose extradition is sought , information on his or her nationality , whereabouts , his photo and/or fingerprints where possible , and a reference to the estimation of the damage caused by the criminal offence . A certified copy of a decision on taking the person into custody with the statement of facts should be attached to the request .
CARDINAL . Under LAW ( the CCrP – in force at the material time ) wherever a crime is committed , proceedings conducted on NORP territory are always governed by the NORP law on criminal procedure .
CARDINAL . A decision to order detention can only be taken by a prosecutor or a court ( Articles CARDINAL , CARDINAL and CARDINAL of the CCrP ) .

CARDINAL . A prosecutor ’s order or court decision ordering detention must be reasoned and justified ( Article CARDINAL ) . The accused must be informed of the detention order and must have the procedure for lodging an appeal explained to him or her ( Article CARDINAL ) .

CARDINAL . An investigating authority should issue a report pertaining to each arrest . The report should include the following information : the grounds and reasons for the arrest , its date , time and place , the arrestee ’s explanations , and the time when the report was drawn up . The investigating authority should transmit the report to a prosecutor within TIME . Within TIME following the receipt of the report , the prosecutor should authorise the person ’s detention or release him ( LAW CCrP ) .
